title: Clippy fix for clippy::useless_format truncates variable name in substitution

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

`clippy::useless_format` removes the first and last characters from the variable name when trying to replace `format!` with `to_string`.

Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
fn main() {
    let tree = "Foo";
    foo(format!("{tree}"));
}

fn foo(s: String) {
    dbg!(s);
}

```

The current output is:

```
$ cargo clippy --fix
warning: failed to automatically apply fixes suggested by rustc to crate `clippy_fix_bug_repo`

after fixes were automatically applied the compiler reported errors within these files:

  * src/main.rs

The following errors were reported:
error[E0425]: cannot find value `re` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:3:9
  |
3 |     foo(re.to_string());
  |         ^^ not found in this scope

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`.
Original diagnostics will follow.

warning: useless use of `format!`
 --> src/main.rs:3:9
  |
3 |     foo(format!("{tree}"));
  |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: consider using `.to_string()`: `re.to_string()`
  |
  = note: `#[warn(clippy::useless_format)]` on by default
  = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#useless_format

warning: `clippy_fix_bug_repo` (bin "clippy_fix_bug_repo") generated 1 warning
warning: `clippy_fix_bug_repo` (bin "clippy_fix_bug_repo" test) generated 1 warning (1 duplicate)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.27s

```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->

<!--
If dramatically different output is caused by small changes, consider also
adding them here.

If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions. The output might also be
different depending on the Edition.
-->
Removing the function call to `foo` doesn't trigger the lint at all
```rust
fn main() {
    let tree = "Foo";
    dbg!(format!("{tree}"));
}
```

Using a variable name with 2 letters
```rust
fn main() {
    let ab = "Foo";
    foo(format!("{ab}"));
}

fn foo(s: String) {
    dbg!(s);
}
```
produces the following error:
```
The following errors were reported:
error: expected expression, found `.`
 --> src/main.rs:3:9
  |
3 |     foo(.to_string());
  |         ^ expected expression

error: aborting due to previous error

Original diagnostics will follow.

warning: useless use of `format!`
 --> src/main.rs:3:9
  |
3 |     foo(format!("{ab}"));
  |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: consider using `.to_string()`: `.to_string()`
  |
  = note: `#[warn(clippy::useless_format)]` on by default
  = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#useless_format


```

Using a variable name with 1 letter
```rust
fn main() {
    let x = "Foo";
    foo(format!("{x}"));
}

fn foo(s: String) {
    dbg!(s);
}

```
successfully performs the substitution and replaces `format!("{x}")` with `x.to_string()`.
